page.title: 01View - Ballycraigy/Ballyearl
page.content: { }The {LANDSCAPE}is still rural in appearance. The S.E. part of the block,the Mossley area lies on the lower slopes of Carnmoney Hill and in the{VALLEY} below.On the other side of the{VALLEY} is the Ballyearl area on the slopes of a range of low{HILLS}from Knockagh to Carntall. The land rises to the N. forming a{ {PLAIN}the Ballycraigy and Kingsmoss district.From the N.W. the little Three Mile Water{RIVER}meanders diagonally across the{PLAIN}and down the{VALLEY}through Mossley to the sea a few miles away at Whiteabbey. From the{PLAIN}you can see the distant{HILLS},even Slemish,St.Patrick's hill.
